Hey, I'm Justin

I practice full-stack design and eat full-stack sandwiches.

Work

Email

I'm currently the principal UX designer and information architect (and occasional front-end developer) at Media Temple, a webhosting and support provider. I design and guide the creation of user experiences for all of Media Temple's products. On the side, I design and develop Two Words For, an online arts and literary magazine (and a constantly-changing work in progress). I've been interviewed by InVision and featured in Mention's Field Guide To Design. I also write for the Media Temple blog.

Info

Justin Barr Young is a full-stack designer pushing pixels and code in sunny Los Angeles. He's been working, learning, and mentoring in the sweet spot where design and dev meet since 2006. Currently, heâ€™s the principal UX designer and information architect at Media Temple, a web hosting and cloud services company, where it's his mission to make technology easy and valuable for users. In his (rare) time away from his computer, he's out gardening, sampling local beers, or making sandwiches.

He built this site using LESS, Jekyll, CodeKit, and parts of Novastrap by @itsmeara.
